questions.question: What is the primary feature of ENS?

options.B: Web3 username and profile data storage

questions.fun_fact: ENS allows users to own their username, store avatars, and other profile data, usable across various services.

questions.question: What does ENS stand for?
questions.fun_fact: ENS stands for Ethereum Name Service, a key component of Ethereum's aim to be the internet's value layer.

questions.question: How many names has ENS registered?
questions.fun_fact: ENS has registered 2.14 million names, showcasing its widespread adoption and integration.

questions.question: What can ENS names store and receive?
questions.fun_fact: ENS names can store all your addresses to receive any cryptocurrency, token, or NFT.

questions.question: What is the native name suffix for ENS?
questions.fun_fact: .ETH is the native name suffix for ENS, providing full security benefits of blockchain-native integration.
